words.definition: An astronaut is a person who goes into outer space.
words.example: The astronaut cleaned the space station.

words.definition: When you are awake, you are not asleep.
words.example: Sometimes I am still awake at midnight.

words.definition: Courage is being brave.
words.example: The man had the courage to touch the lion.

words.definition: To float is to move on top of water or in the air.
words.example: The bubbles floated in the air.

words.definition: To grant something is to allow someone to have it.
words.example: The teacher granted us a break.

words.definition: Gravity is the force that makes things fall to Earth.
words.example: Gravity pulls objects toward the ground.

words.definition: A jewel is a beautiful stone that is worth a lot of money.
words.example: A diamond is a famous jewel.

words.definition: A miner is a person who works in a mine.
words.example: The miners worked hard underground.

words.definition: A mineral is a type of substance found in the Earth.
words.example: Rocks are made of different minerals.

words.definition: To participate is to take part in something.
words.example: Everyone participated in the game.

words.definition: Permission is the act of allowing someone to do something.
words.example: I got permission to go to the party.

words.definition: To pour a liquid means to make it come out of a container.
words.example: I poured some milk into my cereal.

words.definition: Presence is the state of being in a place.
words.example: Her presence made the room feel brighter.

words.definition: If something is raw, it is not cooked.
words.example: I like to eat raw carrots.

words.definition: A satellite is something that is sent into space to get information.
words.example: The satellite sends signals to the TV.

words.definition: A scale is something used to measure weight.
words.example: I stepped on the scale to see how much I weighed.

words.definition: To skip is to not do something that you should do.
words.example: I skipped lunch because I was busy.

words.definition: To stretch is to make your body or an object longer.
words.example: She stretched her arms before the race.

words.definition: A telescope is a tool used to see things far away.
words.example: We used a telescope to look at the stars.

words.definition: When something is underground, it is below the surface of the Earth.
words.example: Trains can travel underground.
